org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.spi

Interface DatastoreProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseDatastoreProvider

    public interface DatastoreProvider
extends Service
    Provides datastore-centric configurations and native access.

    Implementations of this service offer native interfaces to access the underlying datastore. They are also responsible for starting and stopping the connection to the datastore.

    Instead of implementing this interface directly, consider to extend BaseDatastoreProvider instead.

    Author:
    Emmanuel Bernard <emmanuel@hibernate.org>, Gunnar Morling

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultDialect

        Class<? extends GridDialect> getDefaultDialect()
        Returns the GridDialect type for the underlying datastore.
        Returns:
        The GridDialect type; Never null.

      • getDefaultQueryParserServiceType

        Class<? extends QueryParserService> getDefaultQueryParserServiceType()
        Returns the type of QueryParserService to be used for executing queries against the underlying datastore.
        Returns:
        The query parser implementation type of the current dialect or null if the underlying datastore does not support the execution of queries and full-text searches via Lucene / Hibernate Search are to be used instead.

      • getSchemaDefinerType

        Class<? extends SchemaDefiner> getSchemaDefinerType()
        Returns the type of the SchemaDefiner of this datastore. An instance of this type will be added to the service registry using the SchemaDefiner service role.
        Returns:
        the schema definer type

      • allowsTransactionEmulation

        boolean allowsTransactionEmulation()
        Whether the underlying datastore allows emulation of transactions.

        Only of relevance if this provider does not return a custom TransactionCoordinatorBuilder from getTransactionCoordinatorBuilder(TransactionCoordinatorBuilder).

        When transaction emulation is used, transactions only demarcate a unit of work. The transaction emulation will make sure that at commit time all required changes are flushed, but there are otherwise no true transaction, in particular rollback, semantics.

        Returns:
        true if the underlying datastore allows transaction emulation, false otherwise.

      • getTransactionCoordinatorBuilder

        TransactionCoordinatorBuilder getTransactionCoordinatorBuilder(TransactionCoordinatorBuilder coordinatorBuilder)
        Allow the DatastoreProvider to replace/wrap the current TransactionCoordinatorBuilder.
        Parameters:
        coordinatorBuilder - the current TransactionCoordinatorBuilder
        Returns:
        the same TransactionCoordinatorBuilder, or a new one if database needs additional functionalities.
